For example, countries like Vietnam and Mexico have seen massive job creation and rising wages in sectors like manufacturing and technology after joining global trade networks through FTAs.

When a country improves its labor laws to meet the standards of an FTA, it benefits its workers directly.

This not only makes them more valuable in the job market but also opens up new opportunities in higher-paying sectors.

In short, free trade agreements don’t just benefit corporations—they create a ripple effect that improves wages, working conditions, and economic opportunities for workers in every participating country. It’s a win-win when trade is fair, open, and inclusive.
